Class ControlsController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.controls.ControlsController
public class ControlsController extends Object
Controller for the controls UI. UI wiring and presentation live here. Core key mapping logic has been moved to KeyBindings to follow SRP and improve testability.

    • ControlsController

      public ControlsController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initialize controller after FXML injection.

      Wire up the view helper, populate button labels from KeyBindings, and configure capture/hover handlers for interactive key assignment.

    • setDefaultKeys

      public void setDefaultKeys(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode left, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode right, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode rotate, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode down, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode hard)

    • setDefaultKeys

      public void setDefaultKeys(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode left, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode right, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode rotate, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode down, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode hard, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode sw)

    • setKeyAvailabilityChecker

      public void setKeyAvailabilityChecker(BiPredicate<javafx.scene.input.KeyCode,javafx.scene.control.Button> checker)
      Sets a checker used to validate key availability across contexts.

      The checker is invoked when assigning a key to ensure the chosen key is allowed (for example, not already used by the other player).

      Parameters:
      checker - predicate receiving the candidate KeyCode and the Button being configured, returning true if the key may be assigned

    • init

      public void init(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode left, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode right, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode rotate, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode down, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode hard)
      Initialize the current key bindings shown in the UI.
      Parameters:
      left - key for left movement (may be null to leave unchanged)
      right - key for right movement (may be null to leave unchanged)
      rotate - key for rotation (may be null to leave unchanged)
      down - key for soft drop (may be null to leave unchanged)
      hard - key for hard drop (may be null to leave unchanged)

    • init

      public void init(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode left, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode right, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode rotate, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode down, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode hard, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode sw)
      Initialize current key bindings and the switch key.
      Parameters:
      left - key for left movement
      right - key for right movement
      rotate - key for rotation
      down - key for soft drop
      hard - key for hard drop
      sw - key for piece switch
